passage.title: Use it in my garden!
passage.paragraph: Once Mark Twain wants to borrow some books from a friend. But the friend says, "I never let anyone take books away from my library."

A few days later, in order to cut the grass, the friend wants to borrow a lawn mower from Mark Twain. Mark Twain says, "Though my lawn mower is old, I never let anyone take it away from my home. If you want to use the lawn mower, use it in my garden.
